div.pre: 2153 Palma di Montechiaro (found betw. (789) Palma and Agrigento), 1929 Burial: c. 300 B.C. (Jenkins-Lewis) Contents: 1 EL, 77 AR Siculo-Punic: 8 tetradr. (Arethusa/horse [1]; Arethusa/horse hd. [2]; Heracles/ horse hd. [5]) Carthage: 1 EL (Jenkins-Lewis, Grps. IV- VII) Pegasi: (69) incl. Corinth: 17 (incl. most of Per. V) Ambracia: 2 (as Ravel 138, 176) Anactorium: 17 Argos: 1 (as Ravel, Ambracia pl. 18, 12-3) Dyrrhachium: 2 Leucas: 7 (latest BMC pl. 36, 25-2 ex.) Locri: 4 Unc.: 4 Disposition: Palermo 70 (Sic.-Punic 4, Pe- gasi 66) Marconi, NSc 1931, p. 404 Tusa Cutroni, AIIN 1956, p. 209 Jenkins-Lewis, Carthage, p. 56 One Mamertine AE (Marconi no. 79) as- sociated with this find is now reported to be of Syracuse 344-36 B.C. (AIIN 1960-1, p. 88)
